alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Cascade County below 5000ft; East Glacier Park Region; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Fergus County below 4500ft; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Northern Blaine County; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 1:46PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Snow showers with blowing snow to continue this afternoon... Light snow showers will continue to combine with gusty northwest winds this afternoon to reduce visibility in blowing snow across much of North Central and Central Montana. Additional snowfall should mostly be less than one inch at lower elevations, with another inch or two possible in the mountains. Northwest winds gusting in excess of 40 mph at times will reduce visibility to less than two miles at times in blowing snow. Roads will also become icy in spots, so be prepared for rapidly changing road and visibility conditions.
